hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via 20D Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) with 20-day realized volatility compressing below 40% annualized for 5+ consecutive days, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std dev) on >1.5x average volume signals transition to BULL regime with 3-day momentum continuation.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral regimes often precedes directional breaks. Low volatility suggests equilibrium; breakout with volume indicates institutional accumulation. Regulatory clarity (MiCA/UK) may provide fundamental catalyst for sustained moves.
entry_conditions: BTC 20D realized volatility < 40% annualized for ≥5 days
BTC price closes above 20D Bollinger Band upper band (2 std dev)
Volume > 1.5x 20D average volume on breakout day

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7% gain from entry OR regime shifts to BULL (confidence >70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 3% loss from entry OR price closes back inside Bollinger Bands

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to hold >2 days, volume doesn't sustain, or price immediately reverts to range (false breakout pattern).
